analyzed: de'i mig gi zhes pa @118b la sogs pa ni sngar bzhin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa bzhi po'i sa bon dgod pa 'chad par byed pa 'chad par 'gyur bzhin par rtogs par bya'o //

original: nu ma rgyas ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nu ma rgyas ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mountains are like mountains, because they have full breasts, etc.

analyzed: rnam par dben pa zhes pa ni rnam par dben pa rnams dang 'dra ba ni rnam par dben pa ste /

original: skyes bu gzhan bsten pa nyid las so //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan bsten pa nyid las so //

original: klu dang 'bab chu rnams su ni klu dang 'bab chu rnams dang 'dra bar rtag tu skyes bu la mtshungs par 'bab pa thun mong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klu dang 'bab chu rnams su ni klu dang 'bab chu rnams dang 'dra bar rtag tu skyes bu la mtshungs par 'bab pa thun mong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the nƒÅgas and rivers, the rivers are always flowing in a way that is similar to the nƒÅgas, because they are common to both.

analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni yang dag par yod pa'i don gsal bar 'dir bstan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la gnas phun sum tshogs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la gnas phun sum tshogs zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù and so forth. The ‚Äúperfection of the place‚Äù

original: drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyis tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyis tha dad pa'o //
translated: is the difference between the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa sngar bshad pa 'dir sbrel lo //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa sngar bshad pa 'dir sbrel lo //
translated: Vairocana is mentioned here, as explained above.

analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa ma gsungs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to those not mentioned, such as Ratnasa·πÉbhava,

translated: it is said, ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù and so forth.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dgod pa ni 'dir gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang sbrel par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dgod pa ni 'dir gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang sbrel par gsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúK·π£itigarbha and so forth‚Äù indicates the bodhisattvas mentioned previously. Their placement here clarifies the excellence of the place.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is literal.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa la ltos pa dang bcas pas so ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa la ltos pa dang bcas pas so ;
translated: ‚ÄúBy the completion stage‚Äù means in dependence on the previously taught creation stage.

analyzed: / rtse mo lnga pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo ston pa ste /

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la dmigs pa'i rim pa ni 'dir mngon par dgongs pa mthar thug pa'o //üîΩ'bar ba lnga zhes pa la sogs pas ji ltar rigs par dbang po dang yul lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la dmigs pa'i rim pa ni 'dir mngon par dgongs pa mthar thug pa'o // 'bar ba lnga zhes pa la sogs pas ji ltar rigs par dbang po dang yul lnga po rnams so //

original: ldang zhing @119a * //
analyzed: ldang zhing @119a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfive blazing‚Äù and so forth teaches the five sense faculties and their objects as appropriate.

original: rgyu ba dang / rnam par rgyu ba dang / nges par rgyu ba dang / yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba rnams dang 'brel bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang / rnam par rgyu ba dang / nges par rgyu ba dang / yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba rnams dang 'brel bar ston par byed do //

analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba zhes pa la sogs pas brjod pa'i rlung gi dbang las dbang po rnams 'dzin par byed pa nyid du bstan no //

original: rab tu 'byung bas zhes pa ni dbang po rnams zhes pa lhag ma dang / dbang po rnams la khyad par dang / dbang po rnams la khyad par sbyor bar byed pa rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: rang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can rab tu bskor bas zhes pa ni dbang po lnga po rnams la 'od zer lnga la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can rab tu bskor bas zhes pa ni dbang po lnga po rnams la 'od zer lnga la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The statement by turning the five faculties and so on means that the five faculties are the five lights and so on, which are the three syllables.

original: de rnams zhes pa ni dbang po rnams la sbyor bas drangs la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams zhes pa ni dbang po rnams la sbyor bas drangs la zhes pa'o //

original: de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pas mngon shes lnga brjod nas 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pas sprul pa'i sku la dmigs pa'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi sku /
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pas mngon shes lnga brjod nas 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pas sprul pa'i sku la dmigs pa'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi sku /

original: rdo rje nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' ni 'od gsal las langs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The vajra space is the clear light itself, because it arises from it.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha rnam pa'o //

original: bsams shing shes par bya'o zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la ltos pas las nyid do //
analyzed: bsams shing shes par bya'o zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la ltos pas las nyid do //

original: de'i dbus su gnas pa ni de'i phung po'i nang du son pa'o //üîΩdbang po ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs ni de dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su gnas pa ni de'i phung po'i nang du son pa'o // dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs ni de dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Abiding in its center means entering into the middle of its aggregate.üîΩThe sense faculties are the collection of the eye and other sense faculties.

analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer ni kha dog dkar po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste 'dir dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'od de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äújust like that light,‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: de rnams la zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la drangs pa zhes pa ni dang po'i tshogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the objects such as form. ‚ÄúAttracted‚Äù means the first assembly.

original: rab tu 'byung bas ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúGoing forth‚Äù means

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'i gnas so //
translated: the abode of the Buddha‚Äôs emanation body.

original: de rnams kyi gnas ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir abode‚Äù means

analyzed: me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ye shes kyi skur yod bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the five pristine awarenesses such as the mirror-like pristine awareness, which exist as the nature of the aggregates and so forth, in the nature of the pristine awareness body.

original: khams gsum pa'i lus zhes pa ni khams gsum pa'i lus su @119b rdzogs pa sems dpa'i lus te rnal 'byor pa'i sku dag ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lus zhes pa ni khams gsum pa'i lus su @119b rdzogs pa sems dpa'i lus te rnal 'byor pa'i sku dag ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodies of the three realms‚Äù means the bodies of the three realms are perfected in the body of the bodhisattva, because the bodies of the yogins are of the nature of Vairocana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúVairocana,‚Äù and so forth.

original: aom zhes bya ba'i ye shes sems dpa'i zhes pa ni dang por rdo rje 'chang chen por gsungs pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i dbang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dag ni rim pa gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba'i ye shes sems dpa'i zhes pa ni dang por rdo rje 'chang chen por gsungs pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i dbang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dag ni rim pa gzhan nyid do //
translated: The gnosis being of the syllable O·πÇ is the empowerment of the gnosis being taught first in Great Vajradhara, and the concentration being is another stage.

analyzed: don 'di nyid gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i don rgyas par bshad pa sngags kyi dam tshig gi de nyid yi ge gsum las rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po rig pa'i skyes bu ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The meaning of this very statement is explained extensively by the words ‚Äúthe reality of the mantra commitments‚Äù and so on. The Great Vajradhara who is perfected from the three syllables is the knowledge being, the gnosis body.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation by way of the intention.

original: de ltar las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, the purification of the path of action is

analyzed: bya ba'i las de nyid lam ste lam mo //

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob pa kho na rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob pa kho na rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara is the purification of the attainment of Great Vajradhara himself.

original: de bstan nas zhes pa'o //üîΩsku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
analyzed: de bstan nas zhes pa'o // sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
translated: This is taught.üîΩThe one who possesses the vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: rnal 'byor 'dir 'gyur phyin chad ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dir 'gyur phyin chad ni //
translated: is the one who has attained the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: klog gam yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: klog gam yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or read and so forth.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na le'u la 'jug par gsungs pa'i lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi gzugs gsal bar byed pa'i don du zhes pa 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na le'u la 'jug par gsungs pa'i lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi gzugs gsal bar byed pa'i don du zhes pa 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the statement in the introduction to the chapter that the two aspects of the deity's body are for the sake of clarifying the form.

original: yang na lha rnam pa gnyis gsal ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi lam rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na lha rnam pa gnyis gsal ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi lam rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Or, the clarification of the two aspects of the deity is stated because it is the cause of purifying the paths of virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: de ltar las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is stated as the purification of the paths of action and so forth.

original: phyag rgya chen po yongs su thim pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yongs su thim pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the dissolution of the two aspects of the great seal.

original: le'u bcu gcig par lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa dang 'dir phyag rgya chen po rnam pa gnyis yongs su thim pa don gcig pa nyid ma yin nam /

translated: Isn't the clarification of the two aspects of the deity's body in the eleventh chapter and the dissolution of the two aspects of the great seal here the same?

original: 'di dag lha bskyed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag lha bskyed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because these are for the sake of generating the deity, isn't it so?

original: bden te 'on kyang le'u bcu gcig par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang le'u bcu gcig par gsungs pa ni /
translated: True, but what is stated in the eleventh chapter

original: le'u dang por gsungs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yid la le'u bcu gnyis par brjod pa'i yongs su thim pa ni gnyis ka la mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: le'u dang por gsungs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yid la le'u bcu gnyis par brjod pa'i yongs su thim pa ni gnyis ka la mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: is dependent on what is stated in the first chapter, and the total dissolution described in the twelfth chapter is independent of both.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: By the form of the signs such as the cakra, etc.

original: sa 'og dang sa steng dang sa bla zhes pa ni mtho @120a * //
analyzed: sa 'og dang sa steng dang sa bla zhes pa ni mtho @120a * //
translated: The netherworld, the earth, and the sky are

original: ris dang bar snang dang sa 'og gi snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par brjod de /
analyzed: ris dang bar snang dang sa 'og gi snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par brjod de /
translated: the worlds of the gods, the atmosphere, and the netherworld, respectively.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs pa yang ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs pa yang ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is the one who manifests the various worlds.

original: de nyid ni zhes pa sa 'og dang sa steng dang sa bla zhes pa 'di'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes pa sa 'og dang sa steng dang sa bla zhes pa 'di'o //
translated: That very one is the netherworld, the earth, and the sky.

original: 'byin par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'byin par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: Because he is the creator.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: thugs kyi rdo rjes snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par sprul nas sems can gyi 'jig rten sprul par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rjes snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par sprul nas sems can gyi 'jig rten sprul par byed do zhes so //
translated: The mind vajra emanates the world vessel and emanates the world of sentient beings.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩnam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i gnas las gnas gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o // nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i gnas las gnas gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The other abode is stated from the previously stated abode, beginning with ‚Äúspace,‚Äù and so on.üîΩSpace and so on

original: nam mkha' ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Space is suchness.

original: der phung po la sogs pa brtag pa ni phung po la sogs pa bskyed pa de de'i sbyor ba las phung po la sogs pa dgon pa chen por 'dod do //
analyzed: der phung po la sogs pa brtag pa ni phung po la sogs pa bskyed pa de de'i sbyor ba las phung po la sogs pa dgon pa chen por 'dod do //
translated: The aggregates and so on are generated there. That is the practice of the aggregates and so on. The great wilderness is asserted to be from that.

original: nam mkha'i ngo bor rab tu bsgrub pa ni dgon pa chen po'o zhes pa gcig ni tha mal pa'i phung po la sogs pa la brten nas sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bor rab tu bsgrub pa ni dgon pa chen po'o zhes pa gcig ni tha mal pa'i phung po la sogs pa la brten nas sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great wilderness is established as the nature of space. One is the practice of the heroes and so on based on the ordinary aggregates and so on.

original: gnas med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can sgrub pa'i gnas gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid do ;
analyzed: gnas med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can sgrub pa'i gnas gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid do ;
translated: The place is the enjoyment body, which is the basis for the accomplishment of the nature of clear light.

original: / nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: / nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa yang sprul pa'i sku sgrub par byed pa'i gnas so zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa yang sprul pa'i sku sgrub par byed pa'i gnas so zhes gsungs pa /

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in the line beginning with the mind-made, etc.

original: rdo rje 'jam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The vajra-gentle one is the enjoyment body.

original: 'di'i bya ba dpag tshad brgya'i khyon tsam du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i bya ba dpag tshad brgya'i khyon tsam du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The extent of its activity is stated in the line beginning with the extent of a hundred leagues, etc.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni /üîΩdpag tshad rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni / dpag tshad rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows.üîΩThe line beginning with the hundred leagues, etc.

original: dpag tshad brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las nyid do //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las nyid do //
translated: is the activity itself.

original: gsal bar byed pas na zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pas na zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word illuminates refers to the activity that will be explained.

original: gang gis gsal bar byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gis gsal bar byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate what it illuminates, it is stated:

original: rab tu tsha zhing 'bar ba'i rdo rje lta bu gang yin pa zhes pa bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rab tu tsha zhing 'bar ba'i rdo rje lta bu gang yin pa zhes pa bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who is very hot and blazing like a vajra is the Blessed One.

original: 'di'i bshad pa 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚Äúblazing,‚Äù etc.

original: slar yang snang bar 'gyur ba ci ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang snang bar 'gyur ba ci ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he appears again?

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares, ‚Äúthe pure nature,‚Äù etc.

original: sgyu ma @120b lta bu'i sku nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i sku mnga' ba'i phyir zhes pa ni dag pa'i bdag nyid du byed pa zhes 'dir rgyu'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma @120b lta bu'i sku nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i sku mnga' ba'i phyir zhes pa ni dag pa'i bdag nyid du byed pa zhes 'dir rgyu'o //
translated: Because he has a body that is like an illusion, he has a pure illusory body. The cause here is ‚Äúhe makes the pure nature.‚Äù

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ni lha ma lus pa bsdu ba'i don no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ni lha ma lus pa bsdu ba'i don no //
translated: ‚ÄúBrahma, etc.‚Äù means all the gods.

original: lha mo thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i phyir tshangs pa'o ;
analyzed: lha mo thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i phyir tshangs pa'o ;
translated: Brahma is surrounded by all the goddesses.

original: / des ji srid du de gtso bor gyur pa de rnams ye shes kyi sku thob pa de lha rnams kyis mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / des ji srid du de gtso bor gyur pa de rnams ye shes kyi sku thob pa de lha rnams kyis mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as he is their chief, they do not see him attain the body of gnosis.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, what need is there to mention others?

original: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na ma yin nam ci ltar mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na ma yin nam ci ltar mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: But is it not just not an object of seeing? How can its characteristics be established?

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is the domain of the irreversible.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi zhes pa ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha las gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi zhes pa ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha las gzhan rnams so //
translated: The domain of ordinary beings refers to those other than the gods such as Brahma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi la sogs pa rnams kyis lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi la sogs pa rnams kyis lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, what need is there to mention humans and so on?

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the domain of the irreversible.

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i sku yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i sku yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the illusory body of the pure nature.

original: thog mar de kho na nyid ston par byed pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thog mar de kho na nyid ston par byed pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This very one who initially teaches reality is called the one who has attained the body of the Dharma.

original: bshad gcig ni yul dang dbang po rnams te zhes pa ni dbang po dang yul dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: bshad gcig ni yul dang dbang po rnams te zhes pa ni dbang po dang yul dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ming ngo //
translated: The explanation is that the objects and the faculties are the names of the Tathagatas.

original: des zhes pa ni bcu po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: des zhes pa ni bcu po rnams kyis so //
translated: The them refers to the ten.

original: phan tshun bsregs pas na dam tshig lnga rnams kyis so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun bsregs pas na dam tshig lnga rnams kyis so zhes pa ni /
translated: The mutual burning is by the five commitments,

original: de rnams kyi dam tshig lnga po rnams so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i thun mong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dam tshig lnga po rnams so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i thun mong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five commitments of those are common to the ordinary person, etc.

original: khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to the special, it is said:

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The three vajras are indivisible, etc.

original: rdo rje gsum ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: The three vajras are the body, speech, and mind, which are the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: de dag mi phyed pa gsum po rnams kyi'ang thugs tsam nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir thugs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag mi phyed pa gsum po rnams kyi'ang thugs tsam nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir thugs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since those three are indivisible, they are of the mind only, and therefore it is said mind.

original: de las byung bas ni brjod pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de las byung bas ni brjod pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Since it arises from that, it is by the nature of the three described intuitions.

original: dbang po dang yul rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul rnams kyis ni /
translated: The faculties and objectsüîΩ

original: rang nyid so sor gsal ba tsam gyi dam tshig lnga po rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid so sor gsal ba tsam gyi dam tshig lnga po rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The five pledges are to be endowed with the five pledges of the five pristine awarenesses, which are the five pristine awarenesses of the five buddhas.

original: rnal 'byor pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the practitioner to do?

original: lcags gsum zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩ'khor ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi @121a * //
analyzed: lcags gsum zhes bya ba gsungs te / 'khor ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi @121a * //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe three metals,‚ÄùüîΩbecause the three appearances are the very essence of cyclic existence.

original: phyir snang ba gsum po de yang lcags bzhin du sra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: phyir snang ba gsum po de yang lcags bzhin du sra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: They are also like metal in that they are hard,

original: rab tu grags pa'i lcags gsum zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i lcags gsum zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: so they are called the ‚Äúthree well-known metals.‚Äù

original: snang ba gsum dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rang bzhin dang snang ba gcig tu 'dres par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba gsum dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rang bzhin dang snang ba gcig tu 'dres par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving mixed the nature and the appearance into one‚Äù means that the nature and the appearance are mixed into one.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes gsum gyis bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes gsum gyis bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The body of pristine awareness is produced by the three pristine awarenesses.

original: ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa dag gis ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad ril po'i don dag gis so //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa dag gis ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad ril po'i don dag gis so //
translated: The eighteen emptinesses are the objects of the whole.

original: rtog ge pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: rtog ge pa thams cad ni /
translated: All logicians

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen as having an object.

original: yul ma yin pa zhes pa ni thugs sems gsum gyis bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa zhes pa ni thugs sems gsum gyis bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: The non-object is the three minds generated by the mind.

original: bsgom par bya'o ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid de'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid de'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be cultivated is the nature of luminosity, which should be known as its nature.

original: rdo rje 'jam pa dang 'od 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rdo rje 'jam pa dang 'od 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: One becomes like the vajra and the light is the complete Great Vajradhara.

original: / dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: / dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the intention.üîΩThus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bstan nas zhes pa ni nye bar bstan nas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bstan nas zhes pa ni nye bar bstan nas so //

original: 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because it is the cause of the spiritual power of the wheel knowledge-holder, first, etc. is said.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la zhes pa ni brjod pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur dmigs nas rnam par snang mdzad phyung ste bcug pas rnam par snang mdzad du dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa zhes pa ni lcags rnon po las byas pa /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la zhes pa ni brjod pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur dmigs nas rnam par snang mdzad phyung ste bcug pas rnam par snang mdzad du dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa zhes pa ni lcags rnon po las byas pa /
translated: Having actualized the Vairocana samadhi means that having visualized the enjoyment body of speech, having extracted Vairocana and inserted it, one should visualize it as Vairocana.

original: aom yig las mngon par skyes pa bsams nas thog mar bdud rtsi lngas byug pa byas nas bsrung ba yang bya'o //
analyzed: aom yig las mngon par skyes pa bsams nas thog mar bdud rtsi lngas byug pa byas nas bsrung ba yang bya'o //
translated: The eight-spoked wheel means that having visualized it made of sharp iron, arisen from the syllable Om, one should first anoint it with the five nectars and also protect it.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog par bya ba'o //

analyzed: ji srid du dro bar gyur pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni yon tan gsum po 'di nye bar bskyed pa de srid du bsams nas /
translated: As long as it becomes warm, etc. means that one should visualize it as long as these three qualities are produced.

original: lag pas blangs nas thog mar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag thams cad la phul nas rang gis 'dzin cing gzhan sems can thams cad la de bstan par bya'o /

translated: Having taken it with the hand, first offer it to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas and to all the Noble Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, and then take it yourself and show it to all sentient beings.

original: @121b bzhengs pa ni langs pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @121b bzhengs pa ni langs pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //

original: sngar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas rnam par snang mdzad du dmigs nas 'khor lo yang dag par bsgrub par bya bas kyang dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas rnam par snang mdzad du dmigs nas 'khor lo yang dag par bsgrub par bya bas kyang dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, you will attain power by first visualizing the Body of Perfect Rapture, and then visualizing Vairocana and accomplishing the wheel.

original: de'i dngos grub 'byor pa'am rdzogs pa'i rim pa lhag par rtogs pa'i don du sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos grub 'byor pa'am rdzogs pa'i rim pa lhag par rtogs pa'i don du sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

original: bsod nams nges par byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bsod nams nges par byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because merit is definitely produced, it is said, ‚Äúall are like Vajradhara,‚Äù and so on.

translated: ‚ÄúThe mandala of space‚Äù means that having made a five-pronged vajra eight fingerbreadths long, one meditates on emptiness, and having imagined the great Vajradhara in the center of the mandala from the syllable h≈´·πÉ, this is the meaning.

analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ces pa ni thog mar rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin dang 'chad par 'gyur ba la /

analyzed: cho ga 'di de bzhin du sbyar bar bya bar kun du nus pa'i don la'o //

analyzed: 'gro zhing zhes pa ni sam sngon ma las aa ta sa ta ti 'gro ba ste /

analyzed: lha thams cad kyi thun mong ba zhes pa ni bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i thun mong du'o //

analyzed: ngag la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //

original: sprul pa'i sku las cig shos ni bla ma nyid kyis 'og tu 'bying pa la steng du 'phyo bar 'byung ba'i phyir thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku las cig shos ni bla ma nyid kyis 'og tu 'bying pa la steng du 'phyo bar 'byung ba'i phyir thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba ni /

analyzed: khro bo gzhan gang yang rung ba'i gzugs bzung ste zhes pa ni /

analyzed: padma'i rdul lta bur ser po zhes mtshon par bya ste /

original: tshad ri rab dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshad ri rab dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rengs par byed pa gsungs pa yang 'di zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: rengs par bya ba la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: rengs par bya ba la mkhas pa ni /

analyzed: dpung rengs par bya bar mi nus pa'o //

original: de'i phyir de yang rengs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang rengs par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: snang bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Illumination is

original: rab tu grags par nye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu grags par nye bar 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes pa ni /

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra las zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be taken to include the three faces, six arms, etc.

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i snying gar zhes pa ni bsgrub par bya ba steng ngam gan rgyal du gyur pa'i snying gar ro //

original: yid dang mi mthun pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste 'gal ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yid dang mi mthun pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste 'gal ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Unfavorable to the mind is unpleasant, meaning ‚Äúopposed.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi ni rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis khyab ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ni rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis khyab ba rnams so //
translated: The beings are pervaded by the vajra light rays.

original: bsdu ba ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan 'jug pa'i tshul gyis kun du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan 'jug pa'i tshul gyis kun du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The gathering is the gathering by the method of the engagement of the form and the reflection.

original: dmar po dang dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog lnga nyid kyi phyir sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje la 'jug pa dang 'thon pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas mnga' bdag nyid //
analyzed: dmar po dang dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog lnga nyid kyi phyir sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje la 'jug pa dang 'thon pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas mnga' bdag nyid //
translated: Because of the five colors such as red and white, sentient beings enter and emerge from the nature of the Tathagata's vajra, and therefore they are the nature of the Tathagata.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir //
translated: And because it is said:üîΩThis entire world is the nature of the Buddha.

original: rin po che padma r'a ga la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rin po che padma r'a ga la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be a precious ruby, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i yid kyi shing rta rdzogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdud la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa sel cing yid kyi shing rta bskyed pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir /

translated: Because it fulfills the chariot of the yogi's mind, it removes the harm of Mara, etc., and is the support for generating the chariot of the mind.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be a wish-fulfilling gem, etc.

original: bdud la sogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu mi dge ba'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu mi dge ba'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /

original: 'od ni tshon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'od ni tshon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: rang gi gnas su ni @135a * //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su ni @135a * //

original: mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par gsungs pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par gsungs pa'i gnas su'o //

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhi ba byed pa ni snying ga'i sa bon las phyung bas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhi ba byed pa ni snying ga'i sa bon las phyung bas so //
translated: The Vairocana assembly is the yogi who has entered into the samadhi of Vairocana. The pacification is by means of the seed syllable at the heart.

original: bsnyen pa ni snga ma kho nar bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dbang bskur bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen pa ni snga ma kho nar bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dbang bskur bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The approach is the Tathagata explained previously. For that reason, the consecration is suitable for the Tathagata.

original: de lta bu'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes pa ni /
translated: Such means

original: sems can gyi tshogs zhi bar byed pa la ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs zhi bar byed pa la ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what should be done for the pacification of the assembly of sentient beings?

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated like a wish-fulfilling gem, etc.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin pa phul du byung bas /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin pa phul du byung bas /
translated: By the excellent bestowal of what is desired,

original: sgrub pa po la 'brel par byed do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la 'brel par byed do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: it is intended that the practitioner is connected.

original: de yang ci zhig dga' bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig dga' bar byed ce na /
translated: And what does that delight?

original: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: There and so forth.

original: rang byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su gyur pa zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su gyur pa zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think, The transformation of the self-consecration.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ni bshad ma thag pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ni bshad ma thag pa rnams kyis so //
translated: All the Buddhas are the ones just mentioned.

original: skyon med pa ni dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The faultless is the freedom from stains.

original: mi slu ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa nyid phur bu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Amrita-kundali itself is the dagger.

original: phur bu'i cho ga shes pas phur bus gdab pa'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: phur bu'i cho ga shes pas phur bus gdab pa'i gnas gang zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Where is the place to strike with the dagger, by one who knows the ritual of the dagger?

original: gsungs pa / phur bu'i cho ga shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: gsungs pa / phur bu'i cho ga shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa'i don no //
translated: He says, Also one who knows the ritual of the dagger.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of Vajrasattva is explained here.

original: sgrub pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor @141b ba'i bdag nyid chen po ston par byed do //
analyzed: sgrub pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor @141b ba'i bdag nyid chen po ston par byed do //
translated: The great yoga is taught by the practitioner, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the object of the practice is taught by the great Vairochana, etc.

original: 'bar ba'i rdo rje ni 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i rdo rje ni 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The blazing vajra is endowed with five lights.üîΩThe practitioner and the circle of practitioners are the blazing circle of the mandala of the bodies of the gods and goddesses, because they are endowed with red light and because the form of the gods is inseparable from the mantra.üîΩThe one who is endowed with the object of the practice is taught by the great Vairochana, etc.üîΩThe one who is endowed with the object of the practice is taught by the great Vairochana, etc.

original: sgrub pa po dang sgrub pa'i 'khor lo ni lha dang lha mo'i sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo 'bar ba ste 'od zer dmar po dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang lha'i gzugs la dang sngags dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsungs pa gang yin pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po dang sgrub pa'i 'khor lo ni lha dang lha mo'i sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo 'bar ba ste 'od zer dmar po dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang lha'i gzugs la dang sngags dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro // gsungs pa gang yin pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The one who is endowed with the object of the practice is taught by the great Vairochana, etc.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The space and so forth are stated.

original: lce la gnod par byed do ni lkugs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lce la gnod par byed do ni lkugs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It harms the tongue, means one becomes mute.

original: snying la gnod par byed do ni sems dang sems byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying la gnod par byed do ni sems dang sems byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It harms the heart, means because one is separated from mind and mental factors.

original: sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa ston par byed do //
translated: The buddhas and so forth indicate what was previously stated, abiding in the stage of completion and so on.

original: ci ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How are the body, speech, and mind?

original: gcig tu gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, By becoming one and so forth.

original: gang zhig sku la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin de byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //üîΩsku la sogs pa de rnams kyis rang bzhin gyi cha la dmigs nas tshar gcod par byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig sku la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin de byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o // sku la sogs pa de rnams kyis rang bzhin gyi cha la dmigs nas tshar gcod par byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: That which is the nature of the body and so forth becoming one is the mind of enlightenment vajra.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rmad du byung ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rmad du byung ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Observing the aspect of the nature of those bodies and so forth, one should apply the marvelous body, speech, and mind because one is destroying them.

original: bshad zin pa dang ma bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po'i brjod bya nas brtsams nas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las kyi dngos grub kyi yan lag nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad zin pa dang ma bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po'i brjod bya nas brtsams nas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las kyi dngos grub kyi yan lag nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The explained and unexplained and so forth. Having begun with the topic of the first [chapter], [the author] teaches the power of the illusion-like meditative stabilization as the branch of the power of action.

original: da ni de'i dbang du byas nas zhi ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni de'i dbang du byas nas zhi ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, with respect to that, [the author] declares the pacifying and so forth.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o //üîΩmi 'gyur che ni 'gyur ba ni kun tu g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o // mi 'gyur che ni 'gyur ba ni kun tu g-yo ba'o //
translated: The great vajra holder is the sixth.

original: 'gyur ba med pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The great unchanging is the unchanging because of being without change, that is, without movement.

original: rnam par mi 'jigs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jigs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The fearless is

original: dngos po de dang de skye ba'i dngos po med pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de dang de skye ba'i dngos po med pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: the non-existence of the entity of the arising of that and that entity.

original: thams cad dbang bskur zhes pa ni rigs lnga po rnams thams cad kyi mngon par dbang bskur zhing rgyas btab pa ni thams cad dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: thams cad dbang bskur zhes pa ni rigs lnga po rnams thams cad kyi mngon par dbang bskur zhing rgyas btab pa ni thams cad dbang bskur ro //
translated: The consecration of all is the consecration and seal of all of the five families, which is the consecration of all.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po des kyang zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga @142a * //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po des kyang zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga @142a * //
translated: The five tathagatas such as Vairochana also means the five such as Vairochana.üîΩ

original: po yi yang ngo //
analyzed: po yi yang ngo //
translated: And the five Tathagatas, Vairochana and so on, also means the five, Vairochana and so on.

original: mngon par dbang bskur zhing rgyas 'debs pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur zhing rgyas 'debs pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The consecration and sealing is the sixth.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa le'u brgyad par gsungs pa'i lhag ma'i lhag ma gcig gnyis lo lon zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa le'u brgyad par gsungs pa'i lhag ma'i lhag ma gcig gnyis lo lon zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The remaining of the remaining, one or two years, is stated in the eighth chapter on abiding and so on.

original: khyad par gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas mchan rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas mchan rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Considering another distinction, it is said all the limbs and so on.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni de kho na nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni de kho na nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning of the manifest is to direct oneself toward reality.

original: rigs lnga ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: rigs lnga ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams so //
translated: The five families are the families of Akshobhya and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Considering the five Tathagatas, it is said thus and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni /
translated: By the samadhi of Vajrasattva means

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the sixth.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa yang phyung nas rjes su zhugs pa zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa yang phyung nas rjes su zhugs pa zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: There, having extracted whatever meditative concentration, the one who has entered after is the Vajrasattva meditative concentration, which is Vairochana.

original: der rin chen dpal dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro ni de la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der rin chen dpal dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro ni de la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He becomes equal to Ratnaprabha there, because he is the very object of observation.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba de dang ldan pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba de dang ldan pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúhe who possesses that yoga‚Äù

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: becomes the lord of the ten stages.

original: snang ba gsum po la dmigs ma thag tu 'od gsal ba dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩrtog pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba gsum po la dmigs ma thag tu 'od gsal ba dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // rtog pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: This is because, immediately upon observing the three appearances, he observes just the clear light.

original: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor la dmigs ma thag tu 'od gsal ba nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor la dmigs ma thag tu 'od gsal ba nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, immediately upon observing the yoga of imagination, he observes just the clear light.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas ni /
translated: By means of the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: rim pa bzhi par so sor bstan pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rim pa bzhi par so sor bstan pa'i rim pas so //
translated: by means of the stage that is taught individually in the fourth stage.

original: phyi'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyi'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the external,

original: rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The vajra sun, etc.

original: mtshams kyi dus zhes pa ni nyi ma'i mthar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi dus zhes pa ni nyi ma'i mthar skyes pa'o //
translated: The time of the junction is the end of the sun.

original: lung phog pa rnams kyi zhes mang po'i tshig ni yan lag bzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir lung phog pa'o //
analyzed: lung phog pa rnams kyi zhes mang po'i tshig ni yan lag bzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir lung phog pa'o //

original: snyoms bar 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snyoms bar 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The ‚Äúunion‚Äù is

original: nang gi shes rab ma la'o //
analyzed: nang gi shes rab ma la'o //
translated: with the inner wisdom woman.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa zhes gsungs te //

analyzed: byung ba ste skyes par gyur nas slar yang nub pa'o //

original: skya rengs 'char ba ni ma rig pa ste snang ba nye bar thob ba nyid do //
analyzed: skya rengs 'char ba ni ma rig pa ste snang ba nye bar thob ba nyid do //
translated: The rising of the dawn is ignorance, the mere approach of light.

original: stobs bcu zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po'i rgyud du gsungs pa yang gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs nas zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji srid par ro //

analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug par shes par bya'o // phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //

original: sangs rgyas mtshan gyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mtshan gyis ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI have taught the path that leads to

original: rdo rje snying po rgyan gyi rgyud du gsungs pa'i phyag dang zhabs nyid rtsibs stong dang mu khyud dang lte bar bcas pa'i 'khor los brgyan pa dang / phyag dang zhabs shin tu gnas pa la sogs pa zhes nye bar mtshon bar byed do //

translated: The Vajra Essence Ornament Tantra speaks of hands and feet adorned with wheels having a thousand spokes, a circumference, and a hub, and of very well-placed hands and feet, and so on.

original: dpe byad brgyad cu po rnams nye bar mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: dpe byad brgyad cu po rnams nye bar mtshon par byed do //
translated: These are the eighty minor marks.

original: stong gsum la sogs pa'i sgra las stong gnyis dang stong gcig pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: stong gsum la sogs pa'i sgra las stong gnyis dang stong gcig pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúthree-thousandfold world systems‚Äù and so on should be understood to include the two-thousandfold and the one-thousandfold world systems.

translated: Having thus described the illusion-like meditative absorption, the text goes on to speak of the activities of pacification and so on, beginning with the line ‚ÄúThe two organs‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dbang po gnyis kyis rab tu sbyor ba'i thabs su bshad gci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis rab tu sbyor ba'i thabs su bshad gci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe method is to apply the two organs‚Äù and so on explains the method of applying the two organs.

original: 'di ltar nye bar bstan pa'i spyad pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar bstan pa'i spyad pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: This is related to the practice that has just been described.

original: so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yang ngo //
translated: The statement withdrawal, and so on, is also [to be understood] thus.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa ste de mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa khro bo phyung ngo zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa ste de mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa khro bo phyung ngo zhes sbrel lo //
translated: The sixth is Great Vajradhara, and he, abiding in the meditative concentration of Akshobhya, emitted the wrathful one.
