analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can la'o //
translated: in that which has the nature of that.

original: nam mkha' bsgom pa ni stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bsgom pa ni stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po bsgoms pa'o //
translated: The meditation on space is the meditation on Great Vajradhara, who has the nature of the four emptinesses.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is:

original: nam mkha' rten pa por byas nas //
analyzed: nam mkha' rten pa por byas nas //
translated: Having made space the support,

original: zhes pa'o // tha dad pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // tha dad pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of not appearing as different, means because of being without intrinsic reality.

original: de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par gzhig pa de tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par gzhig pa de tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of having the nature of that means because of having the nature of space and because of being just that much destroyed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For that very reason, everything, etc.

original: 'di zhes pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: This means space.

original: rmi lam dang 'bras bu dag gi dpe dang dpe can dag rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'bras bu dag gi dpe dang dpe can dag rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The example and the exemplified are stated in ‚Äúdream‚Äù and so forth.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams kyis gang yul du byar med pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams kyis gang yul du byar med pa'o //
translated: That which is not an object of the eye and so forth.

original: rnam pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: It is free from aspects, because of suchness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is unobstructed.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: That which is to be fully known is suchness, by nature.

original: lta ci smos zhes pa gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs nye bar thob pa la ltos nas rmi lam nye bar thob pa dang de'i 'bras bu rnams shin tu gsal bar rang bzhin med pa nyid do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: lta ci smos zhes pa gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs nye bar thob pa la ltos nas rmi lam nye bar thob pa dang de'i 'bras bu rnams shin tu gsal bar rang bzhin med pa nyid do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: ‚Äú How much less so‚Äù is intended to make it very clear that the attainment of a dream and its results are utterly essenceless in comparison to the attainment of the state of being awake.

original: lus la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi 'jig rten ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩrdo rje ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi 'jig rten ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rdo rje ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The world of sentient beings is called ‚Äúbody‚Äù and so forth because it has the nature of the body and so forth.üîΩThe vajra is the agent of establishing.

original: gnas ni rdo rje'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: gnas ni rdo rje'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: The abode is the vajra stage.

original: gang yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba nye bar dmigs pa'o zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: gang yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba nye bar dmigs pa'o zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: The nature of mind is also observed as a division.

original: de'i phyir gang yin pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yin pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: de'i chos thams cad ni snod la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad ni snod la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: All phenomena of that are the previously explained vessel and so on.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba gsum ste stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang chen po stong par mngon par brjod par @148a * //üîΩbya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba gsum ste stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang chen po stong par mngon par brjod par @148a * // bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The space element is the three appearances, which are to be expressed as empty, very empty, and great empty.

original: don 'di nyid shes pa ni dag pa kun du bzang ngo //
analyzed: don 'di nyid shes pa ni dag pa kun du bzang ngo //
translated: This very meaning is known as pure Samantabhadra.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace‚Äù and so on are as before.

original: de yang zhes pa ni snang ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni snang ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the nature of the three appearances.

original: rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la ni lus la sogs pa la kun du mi gnas te de ni skye ba med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la ni lus la sogs pa la kun du mi gnas te de ni skye ba med do //
translated: Since the desire realm and so on are neither intrinsically existent nor nonexistent, the body and so on do not abide in them; they are nonarisen.

original: khams gsum pa las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dang khams gsum pa yang skye ba kun du gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dang khams gsum pa yang skye ba kun du gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it transcends the three realms, and because the three realms are included in all births.

original: gang dang gang gis kyang zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis kyang zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whatever‚Äù means by existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: shin tu dbyer med pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dbyer med pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúCompletely inseparable‚Äù means that it is their nature.

original: rdo rje'i gnas ni dbyer mi phyed pa'i gnas su bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas ni dbyer mi phyed pa'i gnas su bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVajra point‚Äù means the indivisible point.

original: byang chub kyi sems nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBodhicitta‚Äù is suchness.

original: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù and so on have been explained.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf‚Äù and so on are the example.

original: yang na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na zhes pa ni /
translated: Or.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dir de bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that here ‚Äúsuch‚Äù is the meaning.

original: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúdeity‚Äù and so on

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is ‚Äúall‚Äù and so on.

original: drug pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The sixth is MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: de las ni drug pa las te /
analyzed: de las ni drug pa las te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the sixth,

original: ye shes bzhi'i bdag nyid can las so //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi'i bdag nyid can las so //
translated: from the one who is the nature of the four gnoses.

original: dga' ba lnga ni 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba lnga ni 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba'o //
translated: The five joys are the bliss of the five objects of desire.

original: phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa rnams zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgra las de las cig shos kyi sngags rnams bsdus pa'i don ni sman la sogs so //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa rnams zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgra las de las cig shos kyi sngags rnams bsdus pa'i don ni sman la sogs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmantras of garlands, and so on‚Äù includes the other mantras. The phrase ‚Äúmedicines, and so on‚Äù includes the other substances.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan la skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan la skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: Because they are not born from supramundane meditative concentration.

original: med pa zhes pa de bzhin nyid 'di dag gi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: med pa zhes pa de bzhin nyid 'di dag gi tshig bla dags so //
translated: ‚Äú Nonexistent‚Äù is a synonym for suchness.

original: gnyis po zhes pa lus dang ngag dang sems gang yin pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir zhes pa de rnams gang yin pa gsal bas cung zad rten dang brten pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po zhes pa lus dang ngag dang sems gang yin pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir zhes pa de rnams gang yin pa gsal bas cung zad rten dang brten pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú The two‚Äù are the body, speech, and mind. The meaning of ‚Äúbecause of the contradiction of the nature of support and supported‚Äù is that they are not seen to be support and supported in the slightest.

original: de rnams gang 'di dag kyang skyes par bshad pa dang skyes pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de rnams gang 'di dag kyang skyes par bshad pa dang skyes pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to the previously mentioned born and unborn.

original: spyod bsdus su yang /
analyzed: spyod bsdus su yang /
translated: The Compendium of Practice also says:

original: 'dir phung po la rnam par shes pa cung zad kyang med cing rab tu gnas pa gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes med pa'i 'khyil pa gang yin pa la brtsams nas gang gis rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: 'dir phung po la rnam par shes pa cung zad kyang med cing rab tu gnas pa gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes med pa'i 'khyil pa gang yin pa la brtsams nas gang gis rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med do //
translated: Here, the aggregates are not at all consciousness, because they are clearly established as the very nature of form.üîΩOr else, the meaning of the passage is that the aggregates are not the self because of the contradiction of the relationship of support and the supported.

original: yang na rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas 'di ci ltar 'gal zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: yang na rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas 'di ci ltar 'gal zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: The reason for the contradiction is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: @148b nam mkha' ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba'i rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: @148b nam mkha' ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba'i rgyu gsungs so //
translated: The reason for the contradiction is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSpace is not a thing.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúBecause of the purity of their nature.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa rnams gang yin pa yang lus ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos por yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa rnams gang yin pa yang lus ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos por yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: The bodies, etc., are of the nature of clear light, and therefore, just as the body, etc., exist as the support and the supported in their own nature,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin shin tu tha dad pa'i chos ches mchog tu 'dzin par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin shin tu tha dad pa'i chos ches mchog tu 'dzin par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: One should hold to the nature of those, which is a quality of the most excellent kind.

original: de 'dzin par byed do zhes pa bskyed pa'i rim pa la phyung nas rab tu zhugs pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ye shes lnga ste sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed do zhes pa bskyed pa'i rim pa la phyung nas rab tu zhugs pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ye shes lnga ste sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: One should hold to that, which is the five intuitions in the perfection stage, and the body, speech, and mind of Vajradhara, who is the nature of mantra, having been drawn out from the creation stage and well entered.

original: drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyin can no //
analyzed: drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyin can no //
translated: The sixth is the nature of the intuition of the transcendent lords.

original: sku la sogs pa 'di nyid du ye shes gsum las yang dag par byung ba ste skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa 'di nyid du ye shes gsum las yang dag par byung ba ste skyes pa'o //
translated: This very body, etc., is arisen from the three intuitions, i.e., is born from them.

original: thugs rdo rje ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The mind-vajra is the essence.

original: rgyu la ni ye shes gsum la'o //
analyzed: rgyu la ni ye shes gsum la'o //
translated: The cause is the three intuitions.

original: 'bras bu la ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The result is the clearlight transparency.

original: rang gi sems ni snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni snang ba gsum mo //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the three appearances.

original: chos nyid ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Reality is the clearlight transparency.

original: 'di dag la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag la gnas pa ni /
translated: One who abides in these

original: bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: is as just explained.

original: mi smra par byung pa ni ngag gi yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi smra par byung pa ni ngag gi yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the non-speaking is because of the complete transcendence of the domain of speech.

original: de skad ces bya ste le'u zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ste le'u zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Thus it is said. Chapter is the remainder.

original: mtha' drug gi bshad pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen pos bshad do zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' drug gi bshad pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen pos bshad do zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the six parameters is the intention of the Great Vajradhara of the sixth [bhumi].

original: dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba nyid ces pa ni de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i snod so sor brtags pa med par dkyil 'khor de mngon par brjod pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa slar yang zhes bya ba 'dis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i slob ma rnams dang
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba nyid ces pa ni de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i snod so sor brtags pa med par dkyil 'khor de mngon par brjod pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa slar yang zhes bya ba 'dis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i slob ma rnams dang
translated: The empowerment in the mandala is just that. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that mandala without examining the individual vessels of practice, it is said again by this [verse].

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rnams kyis kyang bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rnams kyis kyang bya bar gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the disciples who will arise and the future Vajra Masters should also do it.

original: sku 'dzin pa ni thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sku 'dzin pa ni thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The embodiment of the body is the mind-vajra.

original: bskul ba'i dbang gis bstod pa'i tshig byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bskul ba'i dbang gis bstod pa'i tshig byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Because the words of praise arise by the power of the urging, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata... and so forth.

original: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni thog mar rab tu dang ba'i dang bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni thog mar rab tu dang ba'i dang bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having actualized, means having first generated faith through faith.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams dang me tog la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams dang me tog la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects such as form, and the vajras such as the flower, are of the nature of the Tathagata.

original: dkyil 'khor du mngon par dbang bskur ba nyid ces gsungs pa'i phyir med par thams cad dbang bskur ba med do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du mngon par dbang bskur ba nyid ces gsungs pa'i phyir med par thams cad dbang bskur ba med do //
translated: Because it is said that there is no consecration without a mandala, all consecrations are without consecration.

original: mngon par dbang bskur ba med par yang dngos grub phran tshegs dag kyang grub par mi 'gyur na sangs rgyas nyid la @149a * //
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur ba med par yang dngos grub phran tshegs dag kyang grub par mi 'gyur na sangs rgyas nyid la @149a * //
translated: And without consecration, even the minor powers will not be accomplished, let alone the great powers such as Buddhahood.

original: sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po lta ci smos de nyid kyi phyir rgyud so sor dbang bskur dang dkyil 'khor dag mngon par brjod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po lta ci smos de nyid kyi phyir rgyud so sor dbang bskur dang dkyil 'khor dag mngon par brjod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consecration and the mandala should be understood to be mentioned in each tantra.

original: dkyil 'khor kyi cho ga'i sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur bas dang po nyid du dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kyi cho ga'i sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur bas dang po nyid du dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i don gsungs so //
translated: The means of achievement of the mandala rite and so on will be explained, and so it is said that the first [topic] is the meaning of the consecration in the mandala.

original: 'di dag la sogs pa nyid kyang rgyud gzhan du de dang de'i khyad par dbye ba blang ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag la sogs pa nyid kyang rgyud gzhan du de dang de'i khyad par dbye ba blang ngo //
translated: The and so on [refers to] the distinctions of that [topic] in other tantras.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma dang slob dpon gyi 'brel pa dang nyan pa'i rim pa gsungs so //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma dang slob dpon gyi 'brel pa dang nyan pa'i rim pa gsungs so //
translated: Again, the connection between the disciple and the master, and the stages of listening are stated by again, and so on.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la gnas pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa 'grub par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la gnas pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa 'grub par byas pa'o //
translated: The abiding in the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the accomplishment of the body and so on.

original: sku la sogs pa'i don mngon par rjod par byed pa po yang rung ngo //üîΩmngon sum du byas nas ni kun du dang bar byas nas so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i don mngon par rjod par byed pa po yang rung ngo // mngon sum du byas nas ni kun du dang bar byas nas so //
translated: The one who expresses the meaning of the body and so on is also suitable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having actualized, having become completely clear, all is stated because of being the nature of the body of all the Tathagatas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sku'i dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sku'i dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the mandala of the body.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ri dvags rnam par 'jigs pas na zhes bya ba ni gti mug shas che ba'i rigs can rnams kyi zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ri dvags rnam par 'jigs pas na zhes bya ba ni gti mug shas che ba'i rigs can rnams kyi zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Because it terrifies the wild beasts of the afflictions, means that it is for those of the family of excessive delusion, the rest is self-evident.

original: de la zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa'o //
translated: There, means in the mandala.

original: 'bad pa ni gti mug gi rigs can rnams rjes su bzung ba'i bsam pa'o ;
analyzed: 'bad pa ni gti mug gi rigs can rnams rjes su bzung ba'i bsam pa'o ;
translated: Effort is the intention to take care of those of the family of delusion.

original: / dkyil 'khor lta bu ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i tshogs so //
analyzed: / dkyil 'khor lta bu ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i tshogs so //
translated: The mandala-like is the collection of the mandala ritual.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni zhes pa rang bzhin nyid gang yin pa'am byang chub sgrub pa'i don du rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni zhes pa rang bzhin nyid gang yin pa'am byang chub sgrub pa'i don du rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Of all the buddhas means that it is the nature of all the buddhas, or it is the engagement in the attainment of enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi ni gti mug gi rigs can thams cad dam gang yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad kyi sgrub pa po rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi ni gti mug gi rigs can thams cad dam gang yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad kyi sgrub pa po rnams so //
translated: Of all the adepts means of all those of the family of delusion, or of all those who are adepts of all mundane and supramundane powers.

original: de'i phyir 'di kun zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di kun zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be this all.

original: ngos su re re'i zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i gnas la ltos nas so //
analyzed: ngos su re re'i zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i gnas la ltos nas so //
translated: The one on each side is in relation to the center.

original: de ni gru bzhi lham pa ste //
analyzed: de ni gru bzhi lham pa ste //
translated: It is square and

original: zhes pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i phyi'i gzugs la ltos nas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i phyi'i gzugs la ltos nas gsungs so //
translated: This is in relation to the form outside the stacked house.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gru bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gru bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said square and so on.

original: dri ma med pa'i tshon gyis ni rdul tshon kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i tshon gyis ni rdul tshon kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is colored with stainless colors because the colored sand is blazing with supreme color.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa ni dag pa'i nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa ni dag pa'i nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: The all buddhas are the absence of faults in the pure [sand].üîΩ Therefore, it is said,

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: all and so on.

original: mdzes par byas pa ni /
analyzed: mdzes par byas pa ni /
translated: The adorned

original: byin gyis @149b brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis @149b brlabs pa'o //
translated: is the consecration.

original: 'khor lo'i phreng bas brgyan pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i phreng bas brgyan pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The wheel garland

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: is the mandala of the essence.

original: bla ma las mthong ba rang gis bya ba yang /
analyzed: bla ma las mthong ba rang gis bya ba yang /
translated: One should see it oneself from the guru.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las nges par bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga sbyang ba de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las nges par bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga sbyang ba de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes /
translated: One should draw a mandala of that kind, purified by the ritual of the mandala taught in the Tattvasamgraha and so forth.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said in the Tattvasamgraha, and so forth.

original: rgya cher ni de las dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya cher ni de las dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught in the mandala ritual of that [Tantra] in detail.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha rnams kyi zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha rnams kyi zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi dbus su'o //
translated: Thus, etc. Of the deities means of the mandala deities.

original: nang gi rim par gnas pa rnams kyi mngon du phyogs pa'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: nang gi rim par gnas pa rnams kyi mngon du phyogs pa'i dbus su'o //
translated: In the center of those abiding in the inner circle, facing outward.

original: rang gi phyag rgya spyan ma las ji srid gnas sam go 'phang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya spyan ma las ji srid gnas sam go 'phang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: One's own seal means endowed with the abode or state of Locana.

original: lha'i gzugs ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'am 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'am 'khor lo'o //
translated: The form of the deity means the body of Vairocana or his wheel.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Akshobhya, etc. And so forth means

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The phrase in the east and so forth indicates the retinue of the Tathagatas.

original: gcig pu zhes pa ni btsun mo'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gcig pu zhes pa ni btsun mo'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'o //
translated: The word alone indicates the absence of the consort.

original: spyan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgod do //
analyzed: spyan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgod do //
translated: The phrase Locana and so forth indicates the goddesses.

original: ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni lha mo rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni lha mo rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The phrase in their proper order indicates the retinue of the goddesses.

original: khro bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gsum pa'i sgo bzhi po ston par byed do //
analyzed: khro bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gsum pa'i sgo bzhi po ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase the wrathful ones indicates the four doors of the third level.

original: stobs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grva bzhi po ste 'dir yongs su bskor ba ni med do zhes mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grva bzhi po ste 'dir yongs su bskor ba ni med do zhes mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The phrase in the four corners indicates the four goddesses of the four corners. The phrase surrounded by indicates that they are not surrounded by others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa 'dis rim pa gnyis pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyang yongs su bskor bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa 'dis rim pa gnyis pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyang yongs su bskor bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase the forms and so forth indicates that the forms and so forth are surrounded by the Vajra Body and so forth, just as the Tathagatas and so forth are surrounded by the goddesses.

original: byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod do //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod do //
translated: One should also arrange Maitreya and so on in their proper places.

original: sngags shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa la sngags ni lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis de de shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngags shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa la sngags ni lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis de de shes pa'o //
translated: One who knows the mantra, etc. The mantra is the two-fold yoga of the deity.

original: lha'i 'khor lo'i gzugs su dmigs pa'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'am /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo'i gzugs su dmigs pa'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'am /
translated: In the middle of the assembly mandala, visualizing the form of the deity's mandala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ste sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ste sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
translated: or in the middle of the mandala, in the middle of the body mandala.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis ka yang lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis ka yang lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both wisdom and means have the nature of thirty-two deities.

original: gzhan na re gang rdo rje slob dpon drug pa nyid dang mtshungs pa kho na @150a * //
analyzed: gzhan na re gang rdo rje slob dpon drug pa nyid dang mtshungs pa kho na @150a * //
translated: Others say, Isn't the vajra master equal to the sixth buddha?

original: ma yin nam bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje phreng bas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can du bshad pa de ci ltar yin zhe na sgom pa 'di med de drug pa nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nyid du yongs su gyur pas dkyil 'khor
analyzed: ma yin nam bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje phreng bas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can du bshad pa de ci ltar yin zhe na sgom pa 'di med de drug pa nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nyid du yongs su gyur pas dkyil 'khor
translated: How is it that the Vajra Garland explanatory tantra explains him to have the nature of thirty-two deities? It is not so, because without this meditation, the sixth buddha would be transformed into Vairochana and so on, and the mandala would not be complete.

original: gyi dbang por 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: gyi dbang por 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: will become the lord of the senses.üîΩüîΩ

original: bde mchog gi rgyud kong ka na'i dka' 'grel du bris pa rdul tshon gyi dbus su sku dang gnyi ga las /
analyzed: bde mchog gi rgyud kong ka na'i dka' 'grel du bris pa rdul tshon gyi dbus su sku dang gnyi ga las /
translated: The master Buddhaguhya says in his commentary on the Compendium of Principles Tantra: In the center of the colored powders, one should place the image of the body and both the body and speech.üîΩHaving given the throne, one should perform the mandala offering with one's own seal.

original: steng du khri byin nas dkyil 'khor mchod pa rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas pas bya ba zhes pa ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: steng du khri byin nas dkyil 'khor mchod pa rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas pas bya ba zhes pa ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩsgrub pa po rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sgrub pa po rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
translated: As for this, etc.

original: slob dpon rnams nyid do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams nyid do zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: The practitioners are the masters themselves, as is intended.

original: nges pa kho nar zhes pa ni bza' ba ni lus rgyas pa'i don du sku'i rdo rje nyid kyang 'dir gtso bo zhes de'i phyir nges pa kho nar zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa kho nar zhes pa ni bza' ba ni lus rgyas pa'i don du sku'i rdo rje nyid kyang 'dir gtso bo zhes de'i phyir nges pa kho nar zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: As for definitely, food is for the sake of nourishing the body, and the body vajra is also the chief here, and therefore it should be expressed as definitely.

original: ngos re re zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ngos re re zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As for each side, etc., it is as before.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyang ngo //
translated: As for complete, it is the thirty-two.

original: cho ga la mkhas pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: cho ga la mkhas pa zhes pa ni /
translated: As for skilled in the rite, etc.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs par bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs par bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la bya ba'o //
translated: This is the procedure of the mandala as explained in the Tattvasamgraha Tantra, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor gsum zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor gsum zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: As such and so forth. The three mandalas are the previously mentioned body, speech, and mind mandalas.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bzhi par gsungs pa'i mi bskyod pa gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bzhi par gsungs pa'i mi bskyod pa gtso bo yin la /
translated: Vajradhara and so forth. The and so forth includes Akshobhya, who is the principal deity in the fourth chapter.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor pa nyid du mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor pa nyid du mngon par brjod do //
translated: Here he is expressed as the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sgras sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'brel par ston par byed do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sgras sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'brel par ston par byed do //
translated: The word mandala indicates the connection with the body, etc., mandalas.

original: de ltar gzhan rnams la yang dkyil 'khor phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan rnams la yang dkyil 'khor phan tshun du'o //
translated: In the same way, the other mandalas are also mutually connected.

original: gang yang rin po che rtse mo dgu pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyir rin chen dbang po nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rin po che rtse mo dgu pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyir rin chen dbang po nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Also, because of the nine-pointed jewel, Ratnasambhava is Vajradhara.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni dang po'i don te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni dang po'i don te /
translated: The word and so forth has the meaning of the first.

original: des rin chen dbang po la sogs pa rnams so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des rin chen dbang po la sogs pa rnams so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are Ratnasa·πÉbhava and so forth.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag dang gsum po 'di rnams las gzhan yang m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rnams dkyil 'khor pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag dang gsum po 'di rnams las gzhan yang m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rnams dkyil 'khor pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúof the ma·πá·∏çala‚Äù means that, since MƒÅmakƒ´ and so forth are also the ma·πá·∏çala, they are the three ma·πá·∏çalas of body, speech, and mind.

original: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum po rnams phan tshun mngon par spyod pa la gsang ba gsum nyid du nges so //
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum po rnams phan tshun mngon par spyod pa la gsang ba gsum nyid du nges so //
translated: ‚ÄúBody‚Äù and so forth: The three vajras of body and so forth are ascertained as the three secrets in the mutual enjoyment of the three secrets.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni @150b so sor 'dus par rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni @150b so sor 'dus par rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are individually gathered in the ‚Äújewel‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: des dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams kyi yang gtso bo nyid ni gsang ba gsum nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams kyi yang gtso bo nyid ni gsang ba gsum nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should understand that the principal ones of the other ma·πá·∏çalas are also the three secrets.

original: gsang ba gsum ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir thams cad do //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir thams cad do //
translated: The three secrets are all because they have the nature of MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas thig gdab pa nas brtsams pa nyid ni dkyil 'khor yongs su gyur pa gsungs so //üîΩde bzhin du gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas thig gdab pa nas brtsams pa nyid ni dkyil 'khor yongs su gyur pa gsungs so // de bzhin du gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: The passage beginning all tathƒÅgatas and so on explains the transformation of the ma·πá·∏çala, beginning with the laying out of the lines.

original: de'i kha dog dang de'i rnal 'byor gyis thig gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i kha dog dang de'i rnal 'byor gyis thig gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Similarly, when it is the nature of the ma·πá·∏çala, then at that time, with that color and that yoga, the lines should be laid out and so on.

original: sku la sogs pa ni gsang ba nye bar bya bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa ni gsang ba nye bar bya bzhin pa'o //
translated: The body and so on are to be made secret.

original: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa de rnams zhes pa ni skyed par byed do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa de rnams zhes pa ni skyed par byed do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The passage beginning vajra and so on explains that those refers to the creation.

original: yid skyob par byed pa zhes pa 'di bshad pa ni sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid skyob par byed pa zhes pa 'di bshad pa ni sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning the mind-protector explains this. The passage beginning the mind and so on explains this.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu,

original: mi 'jigs pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said to be fearless and so on.

original: gal te de kho na nyid bsdus pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni 'dir gsungs pa'i cho gas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de kho na nyid bsdus pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni 'dir gsungs pa'i cho gas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that one who abides in the stage of completion, as stated in the Tattvasamgraha, and so on, should not draw the ma·πá·∏çala with the rite taught here,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i don nyid mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i don nyid mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúone who abides in the stage of completion‚Äù will be stated in the Tantra.üîΩAlso, one who abides in the stage of generation, as stated in the Tattvasamgraha, and so on, is seen to rely on the rite of drawing the ma·πá·∏çala as stated in the Tantra.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa yang de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyu la sogs par mngon par brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga la ltos par mngon par brjod pa de bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i cho ga'i dbang du
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa yang de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyu la sogs par mngon par brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga la ltos par mngon par brjod pa de bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i cho ga'i dbang du
translated: Therefore, the yogin of the stage of generation, in this Tantra, in terms of the rite taught here,

original: byas nas dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byas nas dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: says ‚Äúcommitment‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: gnas 'di bzhi ste zhes pa spyi bo dang mgrin pa la sogs par ro //
translated: These four places are the crown, throat, and so on.

analyzed: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa rigs lnga nyid ces pa lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should generate‚Äù means the five families. The rest is clear.

original: nges par gnod mdzes kyi rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du rdzogs par gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams bkug nas sa m'a dza: zhes pa dang spel ba'i sngags bzlas pas so ;
analyzed: nges par gnod mdzes kyi rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du rdzogs par gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams bkug nas sa m'a dza: zhes pa dang spel ba'i sngags bzlas pas so ;
translated: Having summoned the mandala deities who have been completed in the mandala of colored particles of definitely wrathful Vajra Heruka, one recites the mantra combined with ‚Äúsamaja·∏•.‚Äù

original: / bsam gtan gyis bskyed pa'i mchod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: / bsam gtan gyis bskyed pa'i mchod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to the offering generated by contemplation,

original: dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /

translated: The ‚Äúmaster of the ma·πá·∏çala‚Äù is a general term. Whatever the family, the master of the ma·πá·∏çala of that family should first be placed in the body of the disciple or in the k≈´·π≠ƒÅgƒÅra, in accordance with the location of the wheel of deities.

translated: This rite is to be performed by one who has trained in the manner of the present explanation, by means of the method of burnt offerings and sacrificial cakes, by means of the method of satisfying with external and internal burnt offerings and sacrificial cakes, having accomplished it by means of the substance of cƒÅrumata.

original: bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya'o //

translated: The intense suffering is Ak·π£obhya, etc.üîΩHaving visualized the forms of Ak·π£obhya, etc., one should give the command to the wrathful ones.
